summary: Seeking a part-time or PRN generalist position in Human Resources with expertise in conflict resolution, team building, mentoring and coaching, new-hire orientation, DISC personality assessments, training and development, leadership development, and performance appraisals.

experience.title: Advocate
experience.description: Coach, mentor, and develop 100 clients with resume assistance, career counseling, complaints, and problems; develop, manage and evaluate training and organizational effectiveness strategies; promote a skilled, high-performing workforce; create career plans aligned to clients' aptitudes and goals; serve as internal consultant to management to resolve issues such as employee retention, skill development, succession planning, and performance improvement; partner with business unit leaders to assess training and development needs and provide recommendations; evaluate, motivate, coach, and counsel 25 peers.

experience.title: Veteran Affairs Specialist
experience.description: Provided training, education, career counseling, and job placement services; participated in group orientation; administered career scope assessment tests; attended meetings to inform management of training program status.

experience.title: Employment Representative
experience.description: Presented information using instructional techniques such as role playing, simulations, team exercises, group discussions, videos, and lectures; provided leadership and guidance to new workers; developed and implemented 40 standards and policies; managed documentation and multimedia materials; conducted quality-analysis reviews; designed training programs and professional development courses.

experience.title: Training Coordinator
experience.description: Evaluated training requirements for divisions; consulted with department managers, HR and external resources; addressed employee development opportunities through focus groups, 360-degree assessments, and blended training solutions; conducted over 100 employee evaluations; developed documentation procedures for a team of 15 technical trainers; acted as liaison to resolve HR functions including benefits, payroll, attendance, disciplinary actions, counseling/evaluations, conflict resolution, retention, and file management; evaluated requirements for over 50 diverse operational positions to improve productivity.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science: Human Resource Management

certifications: Franklin Covey 'Seven Habits of Highly Effective Leaders' Certificate (2012)
